file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-21-03-04 - RELIEF VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RELIEF VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the check/relief valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT WITH WET 28-21-03-000-801-A CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - REMOVAL WINGSTUB ACFT WITH WET 28-21-03-400-801-A CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - INSTALLATION WINGSTUB ACFT WITH DRY 28-21-03-000-802-A CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - REMOVAL WINGSTUB ACFT WITH DRY 28-21-03-400-802-A CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - INSTALLATION WINGSTUB EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-21-03 Page 1 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 2. CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task is applicable to the LH fuel tank and to the RH fuel tank. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 155 155BZ LH Wing stub undersurface 156 156BZ RH Wing stub undersurface 192 192AL Center lower fairing 192 192BR Center lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing stub undersurface I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Defuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-03 Page 2 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (3) Remove the access panels (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) and ( AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400) shown below to get access to the Check/Relief Valves: (a) Center lower fairing: • 192AL/192BR. (b) LH fuel tank: • 155BZ. (c) RH fuel tank: • 156BZ. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the nuts (2) and remove the Check/Relief Valve (1). (2) Put applicable plugs or caps at all disconnected points to prevent contamination. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-03 Page 3 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

FLOW FLOW FLOW AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB Check/Relief Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 155 B 156 157 B DET. A 3 2. NUT 1 2 1. CHECK RELIEF VALVE 3 DET. B 2. NUT 1 MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW IS OPPOSITE TO THE FLIGHT DIRECTION. 2 DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE INSCRIPTION "HINGE" POINTS IN THE TANK TOP DIRECTION. 3 TORQUE: 56.5 N.m TO 79.1 N.m ( 500 TO 700 lb.in ) 145AMM280154.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-03 Page 4 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details. HINGE HINGE HINGE

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 3. CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task is applicable to the LH fuel tank and to the RH fuel tank. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM MPP 28-11-01/400 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 155 155BZ LH Wing stub undersurface 156 156BZ RH Wing stub undersurface 192 192AL Center lower fairing 192 192BR Center lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing stub undersurface I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-03 Page 5 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (2) Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: • MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW OF THE VALVE IS OPPOSITE TO THE FLIGHT DIRECTION. • DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE INSCRIPTION "HINGE" POINTS IN THE TANK TOP DIRECTION. • MAKE SURE THAT THE LINE FITTINGS ARE CLEAN TO PREVENT AN UNSATISFACTORY ELECTRICAL BONDING. (1) Install and tighten the nut (2) to the Check/Relief Valve (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the access panels below (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) and ( AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400): (a) LH fuel tank: • 155BZ. (b) RH fuel tank: • 156BZ. (2) Refuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300) as applicable. (3) Examine for fuel leakage the access panels which were removed on the wing stub undersurface. (4) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (5) Install access panels 192AL/192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 and AMM MPP 28-11-01/400). (6) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-03 Page 6 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-03 Page 7 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-03-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB 4. CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the Check/Relief Valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 192 192AL Center lower fairing 192 192BR Center lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Center lower fairing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Defuel the LH or RH tank as applicable ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-21-03 Page 8 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (3) Open access panels 192AL and 192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the Check/Relief Valves. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Loosen the nuts (2) and remove the Check/Relief Valve (1). (2) Put applicable plugs or caps at all disconnected points to prevent contamination. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-21-03 Page 9 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

FLOW AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB Check/Relief Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A ZONE 192 DET. A C C WING STUB DET. B 3 2. NUT 1 2 1. CHECK RELIEF VALVE 3 DET. C 2. NUT 1 MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW IS OPPOSITE TO THE FLIGHT DIRECTION. 2 DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE INSCRIPTION "HINGE" POINTS IN THE TANK TOP DIRECTION. 3 TORQUE: 56.5 N.m TO 79.1 N.m ( 500 TO 700 lb.in ) 145AMM280188.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-21-03 Page 10 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details. HINGE

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-03-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB 5. CHECK/RELIEF VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the Check/Relief Valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM MPP 28-11-01/400 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 192 192AL Center lower fairing 192 192BR Center lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Center lower fairing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 28-21-03 Page 11 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (2) Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. J. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION: • MAKE SURE THAT THE ARROW OF THE VALVE IS OPPOSITE TO THE FLIGHT DIRECTION. • DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE VALVE, MAKE SURE THAT THE INSCRIPTION "HINGE" POINTS IN THE TANK TOP DIRECTION. • MAKE SURE THAT THE LINE FITTINGS ARE CLEAN TO PREVENT AN UNSATISFACTORY ELECTRICAL BONDING. (1) Install and tighten the nut (2) to the Check/Relief Valve (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Install access panels 192AL and 192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 and AMM MPP 28-11-01/400). (3) Refuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300) as applicable. (4) Examine for fuel leakage the access panels which were removed on the Center Lower Fairing. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 28-21-03 Page 12 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
